properties.Name: AssetPaybackPeriod
properties.Description:
Payback period is the number of years that is required to recover the initial investment.

Payback advantages:

- Simple to apply
- Addressed investment risk

Payback disadvantages:

- Does not consider time value of money
- Does not consider cash flows received after payback period
- Does not measure profitability
- Does not predict the optimum payback period

Columns.Name: AssetId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Asset.

Columns.Name: PeriodStartDate
Columns.Description: The period start date for which the Asset payback is calculated.

Columns.Name: PeriodEndDate
Columns.Description: The period end date for which the Asset payback is calculated.

Columns.Name: InitialInvestmentAmount
Columns.Description: The initial amount invested into the Asset.

Columns.Name: AnnualCashInflow
Columns.Description: The annual cash flow associated with the Asset.

Properties.Description:
Payback period is the number of years that is required to recover the initial investment.

Payback advantages:

- Simple to apply
- Addressed investment risk

Payback disadvantages:

- Does not consider time value of money
- Does not consider cash flows received after payback period
- Does not measure profitability
- Does not predict the optimum payback period
